title: Mapping Italian News Research Program
snippet: References Fabio Giglietto as a co-author of a white paper exploring how the Digital Services Act (DSA) is transforming data access for platform research. It also mentions his involvement in the Mapping Italian News Research Program and the development of tools to study influence operations.
description: The Uniurb news page mentions Fabio Giglietto as a co-author of a white paper on the DSA and discusses his involvement in the Mapping Italian News Research Program and the development of tools to study influence operations.

title: Commissioni riunite Cultura e Trasporti della Camera (2.12.2025) - Radio Radicale
Il Premio Rimini Mundi a sette ambasciatori del congressuale - lapiazzarimini.it
„România, cea mai importantă țară din lume” vs. Vestul “cel rău” - narațiunile coordonate persistă - EURACTIV.ro
snippet: This article from euractiv.ro discusses coordinated inauthentic behavior in Romanian elections. It mentions that data analysis was conducted by Fabio Giglietto and Massimo Terenzi from the University of Urbino.
description: This euractiv.ro article analyzes coordinated inauthentic behavior in Romanian elections and specifically mentions that data analysis was conducted by Fabio Giglietto and Massimo Terenzi from the University of Urbino.

title: Advancing Research on Disinformation and Digital Manipulation: The University of Urbino at two Key Conferences in Brazil
snippet: Reports on Fabio Giglietto's presentations at conferences in Brazil. He presented research on analyzing political discourse using LLMs and moderated a roundtable on data access in the DSA era. He also co-authored a study with Giada Marino on iterative deception in digital strategic information operations.
description: The article reports on Fabio Giglietto's participation in conferences in Brazil, where he presented research on disinformation using LLMs and moderated a discussion on data access. It also mentions his co-authored study on iterative deception in digital strategic information operations.

title: Il movimento religioso cinese che si è infiltrato in un gruppo Facebook urbinate - il Ducato
The persistence and resilience of misinformation in the face of fact checking - Vera.ai
snippet: A project by vera.ai, entitled “The Persistence and Resilience of Misinformation in the Face of Fact Checking”, was facilitated by Fabio Giglietto and Massimo Terenzi (University of Urbino Carlo Bo) and Richard Rogers (University of Amsterdam) at the Digital Media Initiative (DMI) Winter School at the University of Amsterdam.
description: This article on vera.ai discusses a project about the persistence of misinformation that was facilitated by Fabio Giglietto along with Massimo Terenzi and Richard Rogers at the Digital Media Initiative (DMI) Winter School at the University of Amsterdam.

title: Who is behind vera.ai? Meet the people and teams that make up the vera.ai project. #8 Team of University of Urbino Carlo Bo
snippet: Fabio Giglietto leads a team at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo as part of the vera.ai project. The team coordinates Work Package 4 (WP4) within the vera.ai project, which aims to discover potentially problematic content in near-real-time using a content-agnostic approach, focusing on coordinated sharing behavior.
description: This article introduces the team from the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, led by Fabio Giglietto, that is working on the vera.ai project, focusing on coordinated sharing behavior analysis.

title: How to Detect a Disinformation Campaign - Media Ecosystems Analysis Group
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, associate professor at the University of Urbino, is interviewed about his work in the field of mis- and disinformation. He discusses analyzing large scale data sets to figure out and mitigate bad activity online, including COVID-19 mis- and disinformation in Italy.
description: This is a podcast interview with Fabio Giglietto, an associate professor at the University of Urbino, discussing his research on mis- and disinformation, including COVID-19 disinformation in Italy, and methods for analyzing large datasets to combat harmful online activity.
